meanings.definition: The state or quality of being frosty.
meanings.sent1: The frostinesses of the snow-covered trees sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the frostinesses of the icy wind on my face.
meanings.sent3: The frostinesses of the freezer made me shiver as I reached for the ice cream.
meanings.sent4: Her words were filled with the frostinesses of a cold winter morning.
meanings.sent5: The frostinesses of his stare sent a chill down my spine.

meanings.sent1: His frostinesses towards his friends made them feel unwelcome.
meanings.sent2: The frostinesses of her response indicated she was upset.
meanings.sent3: The cat's frostinesses towards the new puppy was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The frostinesses of his demeanor melted away when he saw her smile.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's frostinesses disappeared when she saw the students' excitement.

meanings.definition: The appearance or feeling of being frosty.
meanings.sent1: The frostinesses of the glass made it hard to see through.
meanings.sent2: The frostinesses of the room gave it a chilly atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The frostinesses of the ice cream made it extra refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent4: The frostinesses of her tone hinted at her displeasure.
meanings.sent5: The frostinesses of the mountain air invigorated the hikers.
